intro: Dendrospartum sardoum, commonly known as the Sardian flamebush, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking, showy red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in xeriscapes and botanical gardens.
